results.title: Letter to Brezhnev
results.creator_credit: Chris Bernard, Janet Goddard and Channel Four Films
results.brief_description: A movie about the craziest, most lovable teenagers to come out of Liverpool since the Beatles. It’s a fairytale full of edgy cynical realism. It’s a love story and an adventure with a rock ‘n’ roll soundtrack. It’s a movie about inner-city decay, the frustration of unemployment and people desperate for change - any change. This film has gathered an impressive array of awards and critical praise but its most impressive achievement is evident by its popularity amongst audiences. Starring Peter Firth and features music from Bronski Beat.

results.title: Gregory's girl
results.creator_credit: Bill Forsyth, Clive Parsons, Davina Belling and Lake Film Productions
results.brief_description: At last we get to see a teenager who doesn’t “have it all together”.. one whose attempts to be super cool give way to eagerness, hysterical shyness, clumsiness and woeful incompetence. Gregory (John Gordon Sinclair) suddenly discovers that “playing the field” doesn’t necessarily mean keeping a wide cover on the football ground! His latest obsession is with the new girl on his soccer team, Dorothy (Dee Hepburn), but his schoolmates delightfully manoeuver him into giving the out-going Susan (Clare Grogan) a tumble.

results.title: The Golden seal
results.creator_credit: Frank Zuniga, Samuel Goldwyn and The Samuel Goldwyn Company
results.brief_description: On a stormy night on the island of UNAK, a young boy named Eric (Torquil Campbell) comes face to face with the legendary golden seal. A powerful bond of friendship grows between them as Eric struggles to save the life of the young seal from the hunters who want to kill it for it’s highly prized pelt. A charming, touching and beautifully photographed family film.

results.title: Streamers
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Nick Mileti, Rank Film Productions and Streamers International
results.brief_description: Set in an Army barracks in 1965, a group of young soldiers wait assignment to Vietnam. The draftees come from diverse backgrounds: two are afro-americans, one a country boy and the other a Yale-educated homosexual. They are confronted by two brutal ex-Korean war veteran sergeants. Sexual and racial tensions build as the men wait in their claustrophobic barracks but eventually shocking violence erupts. The barracks is a microcosm of the explosive emotions and issues which surfaced in America at that time, however the theatrical nature of the original material, (based on a play by David Rabe) is reflected in a static production which is more stagebound than fluid. The performances, especially by Matthew Modine, Michael Wright and George Dzundza are superb.

results.title: Jabberwocky
results.creator_credit: Terry Gilliam, Sandy Lieberson and Umbrella Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Monty Python splinter faction is responsible for this medieval farce of hysterical proportions. Based on the Lewis Carroll play of the same name, the monster of the title doesn’t appear until the final minutes but it is worth the wait as it is a work of inspired dark imagination. Set in the Middle Ages in England, Michael Palin plays a bumpkin son of a country cooper who goes to the city to seek his fortune after the death of his father. The land in which he lives is terrorised by the monster who attacks travellers who pass through it’s forest. Palin becomes the inadvertent hero, chosen to slay the monster and win the hand of the fair princess. Full of dark humour and even darker ambience, this is not a film for the squeamish!

results.title: Blood simple
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and River Road Productions
results.brief_description: This stylish, low-budget, neo-noir thriller was the Coen brothers compelling debut feature and one of the most successful American independent features ever made. In the heart of Texas, a seedy private detective is asked by a spurned bar owner to murder his wife and her boyfriend. Having collected his fee, the private eye decides to make some variations to the murder contract. At this point the plot contorts into a blackly comic, serpentine web of misunderstandings, betrayals and counter betrayals where greed and fear trap the characters in a bloody nightmare of escalating terror. Arguably the most influential take on film noir since ‘Chinatown’, ‘Blood Simple’ established the Coen brother’s trademark style—engaging narrative, inventive direction, offbeat humour and the juxtaposition of grim violence with moments of sublime, sometimes surreal, human behavior. Barry Sonnenfeld’s innovatiove cinematography, (also seen in the Coens’ later films ‘Rasing Arizona’ and ‘Miller’s Crossing’) adds to this distinctive mix.

results.title: Cal
results.creator_credit: Pat O'Connor, David Puttnam, Stuart Craig and Enigma Productions
results.brief_description: Cal, played by John Lynch in a very impressive film debut, is an unemployed 19 year-old Catholic who is unwillingly drawn into the dangerous and violent world of the IRA, becoming an accomplice in the murder of a Protestant policeman. When he gets a job on the lonely farm where the dead man’s widow Marcella, played flawlessly by Helen Mirren, lives with her in-laws, Cal finds himself drawn to her. It is the start of a passionate affair between the guilt-ridden youth and the unhappy woman, a moving romance that ultimately ends in tragedy. This compelling story gains considerably in its dramatic impact from the superbly realized background of the bitter sectarian violence in Northern Ireland. Based on the original novel by Bernard MacLaverty and featuring the beautifully haunting music of Mark Knopfler (Dire Straits).

results.title: Orlando
results.creator_credit: Sally Potter, Christopher Sheppard, Adventure Pictures, Lenfilm, Mikado Film Srl (Rome), Rio and Sigma Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on Virginia Woolf’s novel, Sally Potter, directing her first feature, has made a ravishing film translation of one of the twentieth century’s most controversial books. The story travels across time and gender as Orlando, who begins life as a young Elizabethan aristocrat, lives through many centuries without ageing, and changing sex in the process. Tilda Swinton is utterly convincing as the young man/young woman who finally becomes one with her inner self and finds freedom as her material inheritance is lost. The film’s music and opulent ‘look’ make this one of recent cinema’s most rewarding experiences.

results.title: The Discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman and Greenwich Film Production Paris
results.brief_description: The efforts of a group of friends to dine together are continually frustrated in this often hilarious surrealistic fable. As if in a dream, things go awry for all the characters in this, Luis Bunuel’s deliciously comical and brilliantly performed masterpiece. Co-written by Bunuel and Jean-Claude Carriere. English subtitles.

results.title: Nuovo Cinema Paradiso
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Franco Cristaldi, Ariane, Cristaldifilm, Radiotelevisione Italiana, TFI and TRE
results.brief_description: Tornatore’s loving homage to the world of movies. A celebration of cinema - its mystery, its fascination and its capacity to make us laugh, cry and dream. Through the eyes of the adult Toto, we relive his childhood and adolescence in the small Sicilian village of Giancaldo, and especially his relationship with Alfredo (Philippe Noiret) the Cinema Paradiso’s gentle and wise old projectionist. Hidden together high up in the projection box, they grow to share a special love of movies that outlives Toto’s rocky path to manhood. Hailed worldwide by critics and the public alike, this film is a glowingly warm tribute to the innocence of childhood, the anguish of first love and the emotional power of the cinema. English subtitles.
